lexUnit.name: chain.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a connected flexible series of metal links used for fastening, pulling, etc., or in jewellery.

sentence.text: She uncoiled the chain from her wrist and dropped the pendant into my hand .
` We are putting paper chains on their arms ; they can break them with a gesture . "
The room was silent except for the rustle of Dexter 's pen and the jingle of his wrist chain on the table as he wrote .
He plucked at the fob chain on his waistcoat and produced a ring of tiny brass keys .
All you 've got left are your chains , your pretty golden chains . "
Aisha 's gold chain which I 'd carried away from her house hidden among my clothes was in my hands one moment and the next on the counter in the Oxford Street goldsmith's .
To the east are the Aonachs , the brooding big beasts tamed to a degree now by poor old Aonach Mor 's ski-tows , which it wears uncomfortably like a lorry driver sporting gold neck chains .
She looked cool and rested in a white dress with a chaste gold chain round her throat .
At the end of a long gold chain she carried a Georgian spyglass which she applied in a rather menacing manner to a small , beady eye .
Next morning , decked out like a sacrificial goat in his gold chains and designer finery , Younis left the Sheraton marina by speedboat with Sami Jafaar and Hamadan to meet the octopus .
In the hushed surroundings of a smart restaurant , Boon fiddles enigmatically with a fob watch on a neck chain .
He wore round his neck a scrimshaw on a silver chain .
Ten pounds for five silver neck chains .
He captured Isaac 's wife and daughter , and having promised not to put the former ruler in irons , had silver chains made for him .
The lead singer had a Mohican haircut and lots of chains and zips .
He wore a tarnished gold watch chain across his waistcoat .
Elizabeth had let him wear a gold chain of hers round his neck .
She had abandoned the huge earrings for dainty gold studs and wore a fine gold chain round her neck .
Buddie always wore a hooped ear-ring in one ear and a chain around his neck decorated with the teeth of strange animals .
If you roll a double on the 2D6 roll then the Fanatic has met with an accident , wrapping the chain around his neck , or perhaps his heart just gives out and he collapses to the ground .
Then , still without speaking , Mr Dakin moved unhurriedly between the cows and a faint chink of metal sounded as he fastened the chain around Blossom 's neck .
Sabine unfastened the chain round her neck , and put the medallion gently into the Baronne 's hand .
